intro: Ferolia curatellifolia, commonly known as the Caribbean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Ferolia curatellifolia is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and tropical climates.
